alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 9:59AM CST until January 27 at 11:22PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with the river one third of a mile wide near the Highway 59 bridge flooding secondary roads and bridges along the river. Livestock are isolated and potentially drown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 24.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CST Friday was 24.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning to 12.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will rise to 13.0 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall to 8.1 feet Tuesday morning. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.3 feet on 12/08/1976. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Lavaca River Edna 21.0 24.2 Fri 9 am CST 20.8 12.4 11.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening.this morning at 1100 AM CST.
